title: Did pagan initiates survive by adopting Christian disguise or retreating into secrecy?
first_phrase: In the previous text, it was discussed how the failure of attempts to revive pagan religion led to the adoption of two actions by pagan initiates, namely withdrawal into secrecy or infiltration into Christianity while maintaining their tradition. The survival and continuity of a pagan initiation center for 15 centuries seems implausible to the profane, but to those familiar with the ways and potential of initiation hierarchy, it is not impossible. This conclusion leads to the question of whether a pagan initiation center could have survived physically and transmitted its tradition to the present day.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while it may seem implausible to the uninitiated that a pagan initiation center could maintain its existence and traditions for 15 centuries, to those who understand the ways and capabilities of the initiatic hierarchy, it is not impossible. Therefore, the quest to confirm the likelihood of the continued existence of pagan initiatic traditions in the West, both within and outside of Christianity, remains an important and ongoing endeavor that requires direct experience and participation.
